description.narrative: By 2017, duty bearers for water, sanitation and hygiene fully adopt pro-poor policies, strategies and planning instruments that enable equitable, sustainable and coordinated delivery of safe drinking water, improved sanitation services and hygiene practices., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, most vulnerable and marginalized children and women are using safe drinking water, improved sanitation coverage and hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, duty bearers for water, sanitation and hygiene fully adopt pro-poor policies, strategies and planning instruments that enable equitable, sustainable and coordinated delivery of safe drinking water, improved sanitation services and hygiene practices.

description.narrative: UNICEF Pakistan's technical support ensured, approval of national and provincial WASH policies and strategies and revisions to align the strategies with SDG targets to include gender equality, equity and human rights perspectives. The WASH in School(WinS) strategy at federal, KP, FATA, GB, Punjab, and Sindh were also approved in 2017. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: # of equity focused WASH research/evaluation recommendations incorporated in programmes/strategies
Water, sanitation and hygiene sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available
# of equity focused, child sensitive WASH policy reforms, legislative bills, rules of business and sector plans with budgetory allocations developed

actual.value: 2017:National Drinking Water and Sanitation policies have been revised by MoCC with UNICEF's support to include human rights, equity and SDGs perspectives Balochistan Drinking Water Policy and Strategy was approved. Balochistan Sanitation Policy and Strategy has been submitted for review and approval

title.narrative: % of provincial budget allocated to WASH specific social services, with seperated budget lines

baseline.value: KPK(4.3%), Punjab(4.5%), AJK(2.7%), Balochistan(6.9%), Sindh(2.7%),FATA(7.6%),and GB(4.5%)
